page.title: 15The A217 through Kingswood
page.content: The A217 forms the back-bone of Kingswood and is a main, dual carriage way, trunk road - running from London to Brighton. It was first developed during Georgian times when it was used by up to 50 coaches per day. The volume of traffic using this road now is a far cry from 50 coaches per day, and is something of a problem. Although the speed limit through the village is 40 m.p.h., it is rarely observed and accidents occur only too often. A traffic survey, on Thursday 11th July 1985 between 11.50 am and 12.10 pm illustrates the problem. { Traffic traveling to London: {Cars:396 Vans:35 Lorries:80 Coaches:7. { Traffic traveling to Brighton: {Cars:393 Vans:55 Lorries:28 Coaches:10 The hope of the locals is that when more of the M25 is opened (later this year) the problem will ease.
